thread.title: 8 years for Moss Bluff man in Texas-Louisiana marijuana ring
thread.title_full: 8 years for Moss Bluff man in Texas-Louisiana marijuana ring - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: 8 years for Moss Bluff man in Texas-Louisiana marijuana ring
text:
LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) - Federal prosecutors say a Moss Bluff man faces more than eight years in prison for running a ring that sold and hauled a ton of marijuana in Texas and Louisiana.
U.S. Attorney Stephanie Finley says 43-year-old David Cantu-Lopez was sentenced Thursday to 96 months on one count of conspiracy to possess marijuana with plans to distribute it.
She said in a news release Friday that he pleaded guilty in March, signing a statement that he was warehousing marijuana in Houston and distributing it out of his trailer in Moss Bluff.
Finley says a Lake Charles woman, two men from Mexico and one from Texas were sentenced earlier.
According to the signed statement, investigators confiscated more than 2,000 pounds of marijuana from the group during four months in 2013.
Copyright redistributed.
